headline: AI Is Now Able To Extract Value From Trash While Tariffs And Environmental Pressures Mount. 'We Shouldn't Expect People To Do That'
summary: AI is stepping into one of the dirtiest jobs in the recycling business: sorting through trash to find what’s actually worth something. And with tariffs, environmental laws, and labor shortages piling on, the timing couldn't be better. AI-Powered Systems Are Revolutionizing Recycling At facilities like Murphy Road Recycling in Connecticut, AI-powered machines are helping sort up to 60 tons of curbside recycling an hour. Instead of humans standing over conveyor belts pulling out cans and bottles,
